intro: Flaveria pinetorum, commonly known as the Florida ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as roadsides and sandy soils. It produces yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late summer and early fall. Flaveria pinetorum is known for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in disturbed environments.
